The biggest challenge in redwood photography is dealing with extreme contrast! The forest floor can be quite dark while the canopy catches sunlight, creating exposure differences of 5-7 stops.

Another challenge is scale—it's hard to convey the immense height of these trees in a 2D image. We teach techniques like:
- Using foreground elements to create depth
- Bracketing exposures for HDR
- Finding "frame within a frame" compositions
- Waiting for clouds to soften harsh sunlight

But that's what makes it so rewarding when you get that perfect shot that truly captures the majesty of the redwoods!

You'll learn these techniques tomorrow and come away with much better forest photography skills. Enjoy your creative adventure!
